items.sentence: Even though Tom and Mary went to the same high school, they never talked to each other until they were both in their thirties.
I thought I had paid the monthly fee, but I received a phone call from the school saying that the bill still needs to be paid.
We have to cut business expenses here. Haven't you ever heard of looking at how much you're getting before you start spending?
Mary thought to herself that she ought to buy a new cover for the ironing board since the old one was getting pretty tattered.
My roommate is prodigal when it comes to spending money on movies; he buys them the day they're released, regardless of price.
Looking closer at the photos, I could tell that the weasel was an American marten by the light color of the fur on its throat.
Ray was willing to corroborate Gary's story, but the police were still unconvinced that either of them were telling the truth.
I couldn't believe myself when she pretended to be angry. Her loud voice, red face...the whole caboodle was pretty convincing.
Someone had definitely spiked Tom's drink, because he could no longer stand up and the next morning he could remember nothing.
I never meant to say that the conservatives are generally stupid. I meant to say that stupid people are generally conservative.
